pr_title: Add support for RealmApp (and MongoDB Realm)

timeline.message: Android android.jar to javah classpath. Disable JavaDoc generation temporarily (a lot of links are broken)
Minimal work to get object server unit tests to compile
Add basic support for RealmCredentials. Remove App from most class names. Preliminary work on getting a a network request to work.
Remove UserStore interface. It will flow through RealmApp in the future.
Implementing first draft for network transport callbacks between Java and C++. Added first draft for RealmUser functionality.
Use AndroidX for test artifacts. Upgrade OKHttp. Add test app used for native debugging. Fix most of the bugs for doing network roundtrips.

Merge branch 'v10' into cm/realmapp

# Conflicts:
#	CHANGELOG.md
#	dependencies.list
#	realm/build.gradle
#	realm/gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties
#	realm/kotlin-extensions/build.gradle
#	realm/kotlin-extensions/src/androidTest/kotlin/io/realm/KotlinRealmTests.kt
#	realm/kotlin-extensions/src/androidTestObjectServer/kotlin/io/realm/kotlin/KotlinSyncedRealmTests.kt
#	realm/realm-library/build.gradle
#	realm/realm-library/src/androidTestObjectServer/java/io/realm/AuthenticateRequestTests.java
#	realm/realm-library/src/androidTestObjectServer/java/io/realm/SyncConfigurationTests.java
#	realm/realm-library/src/androidTestObjectServer/java/io/realm/SyncUserTests.java
#	realm/realm-library/src/androidTestObjectServer/java/io/realm/objectserver/utils/StringOnlyModule.java
#	realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
#	realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_RealmFileUserStore.cpp
#	realm/realm-library/src/syncIntegrationTest/java/io/realm/objectserver/utils/StringOnlyModule.java
#	realm/realm-library/src/syncTestUtils/java/io/realm/objectserver/utils/StringOnlyModule.java
#	realm/realm-library/src/testUtils/java/io/realm/rule/RunWithRemoteService.java
Make project compile after merge from v10
Enable test scripts to start docker. Make objectServer tests compile and run
Send response headers. Use correct url. Fix location value for Stitch
Add Service error codes. Fix http method support in Java. Enable auth providers on Stitch. Better error message when UNKNOWN.
Fix replacing the transport. Fix propagating all errors correctly through the transport
Add a new command web server for okhttp tests. Add tests for the OkHttp implementation.
Magic Jenkins incantations that probably blows up CI
Attempt to fix not finding executables on CI
Add better debug info to Response. Pair down JenkinsFile while testing
Attempt to combine networks both locally and on CI
Avoid using container names on CI
Disable trying to save checkstyle and pmd output

timeline.bodyText: Don't you wan't to add FIXME whenever you comment something out to be able to remember where to uncomment again?
timeline.author: bmunkholm

replies.bodyText: Yes, I should probably add FIXME's to all these places
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: I didn't add FIXME comment all those places - but there are quite a few :-)
replies.author: bmunkholm

timeline.author: bmunkholm
nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: Is the automatic client reset still using this error code?
timeline.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: Client Reset support is still a bit unclear, but if anything has changed I would rather remove/make changes in a single PR since a lot of places are affected. This code was just a copy from SyncManager
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Why not using RealmThreadPoolExecutor.newDefaultExecutor() which builds a pool based on the available Core
timeline.author: nhachicha
nhachicha

replies.bodyText: same for the public-facing API to interop more friendly with Kotlin...
replies.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: We have package level annotation files, so everything in io.realm should be marked @Nonnull by default.
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: access token or refresh token? access token expires more frequently, that it doesn't mean the user has logged out?
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: This makes it less predictable from which user/sync you're working with since a user  A could be revoked/refresh_token expired, then this will default to another user B which defies the principle of least astonishment... I still think currentUser should be limited to one.
timeline.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: The currentUser semantics have been copied from old Stitch. I'm just describing the current semantics in ObjectStore. We cannot change them for Java alone. I added a note to our TODO list that we need to discuss exactly how this should work. There are other concerns around User lifecycle as well.
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Naming: I thought we agreed to use Push Notification directly without prefix
timeline.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: I don't remember exactly. I'll change it.
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: Could not be posted, instead ... and you can fallback to print the error on the stderr
timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: TODO: maybe change to INFO for the release
timeline.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: Added TODO, so we remember to visit
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.author: nhachicha

timeline.bodyText: TODO: doc might not be up-to-date
timeline.author: nhachicha
